response.details: This artwork is a polyptych (multi-panel altarpiece) by Italian Renaissance painter Fra Angelico, created around 1438-1445. The four panels from left to right depict: (1) The Birth of Saint Dominic - showing Saint Dominic being born with his mother St. Agnes holding him while his father and other figures look on; (2) The Annunciation to Saint Dominic - showing the angel Gabriel kneeling before Saint Dominic, presenting a golden lily symbolizing purity and a starburst signifying his divine mission; (3) The Miracle of the Burning Book - depicting Saint Dominic as a young man miraculously saving a book from burning with an angelic figure appearing to him; and (4) a fourth scene from Saint Dominic's life (details partially cut off in the analysis).
response.extra explanation: The artwork is a polyptych by Fra Angelico created around 1438-1445 for the Barbadori family. It is now located in the Uffizi Gallery in Florence. Saint Dominic was the founder of the Dominican Order, and this predella (the lower part of an altarpiece) celebrates key moments from his life with rich symbolism including the golden lily representing purity and divine imagery throughout.
response.inference: Four key scenes from the life of Saint Dominic: The Birth of Saint Dominic, The Annunciation to Saint Dominic, The Miracle of the Burning Book, and a fourth scene from his life
